#### Meet the penguins

The penguins data from the [palmerpenguins](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/) package contains size measurements for 344 penguins from three species observed on three islands in the Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica [@horstPalmerArchipelagoPenguins2022].

![](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/reference/figures/lter_penguins.png)

Another reference is @hamakerCritiqueCrosslaggedPanel2015.

#### Results

```{r, echo = F}
# Plot penguins
ggplot(penguins, 
       aes(x = `Flipper.Length..mm.`, y = `Culmen.Length..mm.`)) +
        geom_point(aes(color = Species, shape = Species)) +
        scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange","purple","cyan4")) +
        labs(
                title = "Flipper and Culmen length",
                subtitle = "Dimensions for penguins at Palmer Station LTER",
                x = "Flipper length (mm)", y = "Culmen length (mm)",
                color = "Penguin species", shape = "Penguin species"
        ) +
        theme_minimal()
```

### Inline code

Sanity check 1 + 1 = `r 1 + 1`

Referring to data: there are `r sum(penguins$Species == 'Adelie Penguin (Pygoscelis adeliae)')` Adelie penguins and `r sum(penguins$Species=='Chinstrap penguin (Pygoscelis antarctica)')` Chinstrap penguins.

The average weight of a Chinstrap penguin in the dataset is `r round(mean(penguins$Body.Mass..g.[penguins$Species=='Chinstrap penguin (Pygoscelis antarctica)']))` grams.
